results.title: Addio tradizione
results.creator_credit: Anna Louise Sortini, South Australian Film Corporation and Open Window Productions
results.brief_description: Childhood memories are recalled whilst Sylvanna (Marcella Russo), a housewife, ponders her adolescent years with migrant Italian parents in Australia. A series of moving images show the Italian customs experienced throughout her childhood and the growing tensions and difficulties in the family as she reaches puberty and the two cultures of differing family values clash.

results.title: Aida
results.creator_credit: Pierre Jourdan, Daniele Gegauff and Stephane Tchalgadjieff
results.brief_description:
This version of Verdi’s ‘Aida’ was recorded at the antique theatre of Orange (France). The stage direction is by Sandro Segui, decors by Pier-Luigi Pizi and choreography by Jacques Garnier. The Orchestra ‘Lirico di Torino’ is conducted by Thomas Schippers.

Credits: Cast: Producers, Stephane Tchalgadjieff, Daniele Gegauff ; director, Pierre Jourdan ; photography, Jean-Pierre Lazar.
Cast: Gilda Cruz-Romo, Grace Bumbry, Peter Gougalov.

results.title: Aida
results.creator_credit: Brian Large, Giancarlo Sbragia, Polivideo and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: This is a magnificent production on an epic scale of Giuseppe Verdi’s “Aida”, libretto by Antonio Ghislanzoni, recorded live at the Arena di Verona in 1981. Written by Verdi for the new Cairo Opera House which had been built to mark the opening of the Suez Canal, “Aida” is set in the golden time of the Egyptian Pharaohs and tells a tale of human drama and emotional conflict, of love, jealousy and manipulation culminating in a climax of tragedy. The lead singers include Maria Chiara (Aida), Fiorenza Cossotto (Amneris), Nicola Martinucci (Radames) and Giuseppe Scandola (Amonasro) accompanied by the Arena di Verona Chorus led by Corrado Mirandola, Orchestra conducted by Anton Guadagne and Corps de Ballet dancers Ileana Iliascu, Rosalba Garavelli, Georg Iancu and Richard Dusquenoy. Vittorrio Rossi’s stage sets and costumes are rich in color and design and the setting of the Arena di Verona is wonderfully atmospheric. Sung in Italian with no English subtitles.

results.title: Adaptive radiation: the mollusks
results.creator_credit: John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Illustrates the principles of adaptive radiation and shows how the typical molluscan characteristics are modified in each of the six classes. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Agronomy
results.creator_credit: Jean Palardy, Raymond Garceau and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Describes the introduction of co-operative dairy farming in the eastern townships of Quebec to increase agricultural output and improve marketing methods. Recalls some of the difficulties encountered in the early days of the Agricultural Co-operative of Granby and cites the success of the Granby Co-operative as an example of what can be achieved when agricultural expert and farmer work in close co-operation.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Jean Palardy, Raymond Garceau and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Actualization through assertion (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Barnett Addis, Robert Liberman, Larry King, University of California, Los Angeles and Behavioural Sciences Media Lab
results.brief_description: Four clients are seen in group assertion training, developing a style by practicing appropriate eye contact, gestures, body movement, touch, facial expression & voice tone & volume. Therapists are seen directing the client’s progress and reinforcing small successes. Practice assignments are given in which newly learned skills are applied to situations in the client’s daily lives. Narrated by McDonald Carey.

results.title: Acts of God
results.brief_description: Takes an entertaining and informative look at freak weather conditions - commonly referred to as “Acts of God” - and at how the human body stands up to their violent effects. Shows the design of windproof structures and their effects on people and looks at designing to meet these problems.
results.description: Takes an entertaining and informative look at freak weather conditions - commonly referred to as “Acts of God” - and at how the human body stands up to their violent effects. results.title: Agonia = Agony
results.creator_credit: Elem Klimov, Semion Kutikov and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
In the final days of the Romanov regime (1613-1917), the ‘mad monk’ Rasputin wields power at the court. He is portrayed as a man completely out of touch with the people and political reality, immersed in sexual decadence and the lascivious manipulation of others. The relationship of Rasputin, the Czar and the Empress are explored in this historical drama, with the latter two falling under Rasputin’s spell. Klimov takes a docu-drama approach mixing colour re-enactments of historical events with simulated black and white newsreel footage. This film was completed in 1975 but due to its sympathetic portrayal of Czar Nicholas II, was not released until 1981

Credits: Producer, Semion Kutikov ; director, Elem Klimov ; writer, Semyon Lungin, Ilya Nusinov ; photography, Leonid Kalashnikov ; music, Alfred Shnitke.
Cast: Velta Linei, Alisa Freindlikh, Anatoly Romashin, Alexey Petrenko, A. Romantsov, S. Muchenikov.
